0: Rep. Mike Rogers continued his criticism of the Obamacare rollout on Sunday, saying the Obama administration should temporarily shut down the website because of cybersecurity concerns. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Appearing on CBS's "Face the Nation," the chairman of the House Intelligence Committee said even the administration admitted there was a “high degree of risk” with the website. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Rogers has been a harsh critic of the Affordable Care Act rollout, and has long raised cybersecurity concerns about HealthCare.gov. At Wednesday’s hearing with Health and Human Services Secretary Kathleen Sebelius, Rogers said HHS had conducted “a completely unacceptable level of security.” NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Rogers also said at Wednesday’s hearing that poor cybersecurity measures “have exposed millions of Americans.” NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR And he echoed that on Sunday, saying it was necessary to take down the website to protect Americans' personal information from cyberattacks. “They’re trying to change a tire on a car going 75 miles an hour down the expressway," Rogers said Sunday. "That’s not the way cybersecurity works.” NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Read more about: Cybersecurity, Mike Rogers, Obamacare, HealthCare.Gov to Sunday.
